result.execSummary:
The defendant Milton L Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with any other sentence Defendant may be serving

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $200. This needs to be paid before successfully being discharged.

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

No contact with the Shopko store in Stevens Point.
Comply with any reasonable and necessary counseling which the agent may recommend.
In the event Defendant comes back on a revocation, there will be no sentence credit.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Milton L Miller in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Milton L Miller in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:31 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing.

Court has a signed Plea questionnaire/Agreement.
State has provided a restitution summary.

Defendant will plead to Count 1. 

Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Found Guilty

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.
Atty Halverson received a copy of the restitution summary.


BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 12 Months, concurrent with any other sentence Defendant may be serving
Conditions:
Pay costs
Pay restitution in the amount of $200. This needs to be paid before successfully being discharged.
No contact with the Shopko store in Stevens Point
Comply with any reasonable and necessary counseling which the agent may recommend
In the event Defendant comes back on a revocation, there will be no sentence credit
Ad Prosequendum with attached Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum /s/ RJS 06/14/16
